description: Signifies that the DS1 line status change for
the specified interface has been detected.

event.Summary: DS1 line status changed on interface

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD WAN-TRAP-MIB::wanDsx1LineStatusChange RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime t 31536000 RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE RFC1406-MIB::dsx1LineIndex i 9999 RFC1406-MIB::dsx1IfIndex i 9999 RFC1406-MIB::dsx1LineStatus i 1

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: A textual description of the entity. This value should
include the full name and version identification of
the system's hardware type, software operating-system
and networking software.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr

description: This object is the identifier of a DS1 Inter-
face on a managed device. If there is an ifEn-
try that is directly associated with this and
only this DS1 interface, it should have the
same value as ifIndex. Otherwise, the value
exceeds ifNumber, and is a unique identifier
following this rule: inside interfaces (e.g.
equipment side) with even numbers and outside
interfaces (e.g., network side) with odd
numbers.
variables.name: RFC1406-MIB::dsx1LineIndex

description: This value for this object is equal to the
value of ifIndex from the Interfaces table of
MIB II (RFC 1213).
variables.name: RFC1406-MIB::dsx1IfIndex

description: This variable indicates the Line Status of the
interface. It contains loopback, failure, re-
ceived 'alarm' and transmitted 'alarm' infor-
mation.
The dsx1LineStatus is a bit map represented as a sum
therefore, it can represent multiple failures (alarms) and
a LoopbackState simultaneously.
dsx1NoAlarm should be set if and only if no other flag is
set.
If the dsx1LoopbackState bit is set, the loopback in ef-
fect can be determined from the dsx1LoopbackConfig object.
The various bit positions are:
1 dsx1NoAlarm No Alarm Present
2 dsx1RcvFarEndLOF Far end LOF (a.k.a., Yellow Alarm)
4 dsx1XmtFarEndLOF Near end sending LOF Indication
8 dsx1RcvAIS Far end sending AIS
16 dsx1XmtAIS Near end sending AIS
32 dsx1LossOfFrame Near end LOF (a.k.a., Red Alarm)
64 dsx1LossOfSignal Near end Loss Of Signal
128 dsx1LoopbackState Near end is looped
256 dsx1T16AIS E1 TS16 AIS
512 dsx1RcvFarEndLOMF Far End Sending TS16 LOMF
1024 dsx1XmtFarEndLOMF Near End Sending TS16 LOMF
2048 dsx1RcvTestCode Near End detects a test code
4096 dsx1OtherFailure any line status not defined here
variables.name: RFC1406-MIB::dsx1LineStatus

description: Signifies that the wanDsx1LossOfMasterClock event for
the specified interface has been detected.

event.Summary: DS1 loss of master clock detected on interface

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD WAN-TRAP-MIB::wanDsx3LineStatusChange RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime t 31536000 RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE RFC1407-MIB::dsx3LineIndex i 9999 RFC1407-MIB::dsx3IfIndex i 9999 RFC1407-MIB::dsx3LineStatus i 1

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: A textual description of the entity. This value should
include the full name and version identification of
the system's hardware type, software operating-system
and networking software.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr

description: This object is the identifier of a DS3/E3
Interface on a managed device. If there is an
ifEntry that is directly associated with this
and only this DS3/E3 interface, it should have
the same value as ifIndex. Otherwise, number
the dsx3LineIndices with an unique identifier
following the rules of choosing a number that
is greater than ifNumber and numbering the
inside interfaces (e.g., equipment side) with
even numbers and outside interfaces (e.g
network side) with odd numbers.
variables.name: RFC1407-MIB::dsx3LineIndex

description: This value for this object is equal to the
value of ifIndex from the Interfaces table of
MIB II (RFC 1213).
variables.name: RFC1407-MIB::dsx3IfIndex

description: This variable indicates the
Line Status of the interface.
It contains loopback state information
and failure state information.
The dsx3LineStatus is a bit map represented
as a sum, therefore
it can represent multiple failures
and a loopback (see dsx3LoopbackConfig object
for the type of loopback)
simultaneously.
The dsx3NoAlarm should be set if and only if
no other flag is set.
The various bit positions are:
1 dsx3NoAlarm No alarm present
2 dsx3RcvRAIFailure Receiving Yellow/Remote
Alarm Indication
4 dsx3XmitRAIAlarm Transmitting Yellow/Remote
Alarm Indication
dsx3RcvAIS Receiving AIS failure state
16 dsx3XmitAIS Transmitting AIS
32 dsx3LOF Receiving LOF failure state
64 dsx3LOS Receiving LOS failure state
128 dsx3LoopbackState Looping the received signal
256 dsx3RcvTestCode Receiving a Test Pattern
512 dsx3OtherFailure any line status not defined
here
variables.name: RFC1407-MIB::dsx3LineStatus

description: Signifies that the wanDsx3LossOfMasterClock event for
the specified interface has been detected.

event.Summary: DS3 loss of master clock detected on interface

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD WAN-TRAP-MIB::wanDsx3LossOfMasterClock RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime t 31536000 RFC1213-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE RFC1407-MIB::dsx3LineIndex i 9999 RFC1407-MIB::dsx3IfIndex i 9999 RFC1407-MIB::dsx3LineStatus i 1

The various bit positions are:
1 dsx3NoAlarm No alarm present
2 dsx3RcvRAIFailure Receiving Yellow/Remote

4 dsx3XmitRAIAlarm Transmitting Yellow/Remote
Alarm Indication
dsx3RcvAIS Receiving AIS failure state
16 dsx3XmitAIS Transmitting AIS
32 dsx3LOF Receiving LOF failure state
64 dsx3LOS Receiving LOS failure state
128 dsx3LoopbackState Looping the received signal
256 dsx3RcvTestCode Receiving a Test Pattern
512 dsx3OtherFailure any line status not defined
here
